event.name: TSA General Body Meeting
event.description:
When it comes down to it, TSA is simply a group of students who come together to have fun with each other and to participate in all the cool things CMU has to offer. Our activities can be as small as getting late-night together or as involved as building booth for the annual CMU spring carnival. We are a non-exclusive org; in fact, more than half our members aren't of Taiwanese descent! Please check us out during orientation week and over the course of the school year. We're excited to meet you!
Come find out more about the members of the Taiwanese Students Organization and the org itself at Monday's general body meeting!
event.summary:
When it comes down to it, TSA is simply a group of students who come together to have fun with each other and to participate in all the cool things CMU has to offer. Our activities can be as small as getting late-night together or as involved as building booth for the annual CMU spring carnival. We are a non-exclusive org; in fact, more than half our members aren't of Taiwanese descent! Please check us out during orientation week and over the course of the school year. We're excited to meet you!
Come find out more about the members of the Taiwanese Students Organization and the org itself at Monday's general body meeting!

event.name: SCS4ALL Meeting
event.description:
A SCS wide, graduate and undergraduate organization working to promote diversity in the School of Computer Science and to broaden interest, understanding and diversity in computing fields through outreach.
The SCS4ALL advisory council is a new umbrella organization that works to develop a program of social and professional activities and leadership opportunities to broaden interest and participation in computing by underrepresented groups including women, minorities, students and teachers in K-12, and others who may feel isolated or left out.
SCS4ALL is open to all students in the Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science (SCS) as well as any friends of SCS4ALL. We want ALL communities in SCS to feel included in shaping the organization and the events we run.
We hope to have lots of opportunities for Outreach. Students who are interested in reaching out can come to our biweekly General Meetings.
event.summary:
A SCS wide, graduate and undergraduate organization working to promote diversity in the School of Computer Science and to broaden interest, understanding and diversity in computing fields through outreach.
The SCS4ALL advisory council is a new umbrella organization that works to develop a program of social and professional activities and leadership opportunities to broaden interest and participation in computing by underrepresented groups including women, minorities, students and teachers in K-12, and others who may feel isolated or left out.
SCS4ALL is open to all students in the Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science (SCS) as well as any friends of SCS4ALL. We want ALL communities in SCS to feel included in shaping the organization and the events we run.
We hope to have lots of opportunities for Outreach. Students who are interested in reaching out can come to our biweekly General Meetings.

event.name: Spiceworks Tech Talk
event.description:
Where IT goes to work. Do your job, talk-shop with IT pros and vendors, show off your IT projects, and get the scoop on everything from products and services to zombies and bacon (yup, seriously). All in one place. All for free!
Spiceworks will be giving CMU students the chance to '93show off their smarts'94 and win. They will have a scavenger hunt style programming game and will be giving away 10 Raspberry Pi'92s and maybe more :)
event.summary: Spiceworks will be giving CMU students the chance to '93show off their smarts'94 and win. They will have a scavenger hunt style programming game and will be giving away 10 Raspberry Pi'92s and maybe more :)

event.name: Samsung Information Session
event.description:
For over 70 years, Samsung has been dedicated to making a better world through diverse businesses that today span advanced technology, semiconductors, skyscraper and plant construction, petrochemicals, fashion, medicine, finance, hotels, and more. Our flagship company, Samsung Electronics, leads the global market in high-tech electronics manufacturing and digital media.
Through innovative, reliable products and services; talented people; a responsible approach to business and global citizenship; and collaboration with our partners and customers, Samsung is taking the world in imaginative new directions.
event.summary: Information Session by Samsung

event.name: FINALS
event.description: A final examination, annual, exam, or final is a test given to students at the end of a course of study or training. Although the term can be used in the context of physical training, it most often occurs in the academic world. Finals week.
event.summary: Finals week.

event.name: SCS Day Auditions
event.description: SCS Day is a celebration of diversity in the School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University. SCS Day is a dynamic event including free food, art exhibits, an evening talent show and CS swag. All the members of the SCS Community - undergraduate and graduate students, faculty, staff, and alumi - are invited to display their talents and share their skills in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. This year, it will be held on Friday, March 1, 2013. Showcase your amazing skills at the Talent Show!
event.summary: SCS Day is a day of celebration for the many talents of the students in CMU's School of Computer Science, graduates and undergraduates. This year, it will be held on Friday, March 1, 2013. Showcase your amazing skills at the Talent Show!

event.name: Volunteer Fair
event.description: PACE's Annual Volunteer Fair provides students with the opportunity to connect with local organizations as well as student groups who share a passion for giving back to the community, both locally and at large. Meet representatives from over 50 groups from a variety of interests and backgrounds to discover exactly how you can make your mark on the community. Whether you are looking for one-time opportunities or an on-going relationship, the Volunteer Fair is a great way to connect and learn about the civic engagement at Carnegie Mellon and in the Pittsburgh community.
event.location: CFA Lawn, UC Rangos in case of rain
event.summary: PACE's Annual Volunteer Fair provides students with the opportunity to connect with local organizations as well as student groups who share a passion for giving back to the community, both locally and at large.

event.name: Study Abroad Information Session
event.description:
With advance planning, OIE study abroad staff will conduct study abroad information sessions targeted to a particular group of students. This allows the study abroad advisor to be specific (1) by major regarding the best time for study abroad and (2) about top overseas universities and programs for curricular fit. Several departments are active in supporting study abroad initiatives through such sessions including architecture and art, biology, chemistry and physics, the CIT first-year seminar and others. These sessions are most effective in conjunction with a supportive faculty member from the department and/or returned study abroad students from the same major or discipline. Sophomore seminar classes are an ideal setting for such a session.
Interested in learning more about study abroad?
Where you can go, what you can do?
Come to a brief information session to learn more about the possibility of study abroad!
event.summary:
Interested in learning more about study abroad?
Where you can go, what you can do?
Come to a brief information session to learn more about the possibility of study abroad!

event.name: Employment Opportunities Conference (EOC)
event.description: The Fall Employment Opportunities Conference (EOC) is a campus-wide career fair for employers from all industries -- technical and non-technical. This event will draw students from all majors -- those seeking full-time or summer internship opportunities. This year the first hour of the EOC, employers will be asked to highlight non-technical opportunities (e.g. marketing, human resources, management, advertising, writing, and more.) Last year more than 1400 students attended.
event.summary: The Fall Employment Opportunities Conference (EOC) is a campus-wide career fair for employers from all industries -- technical and non-technical.

event.name: Temple University Education Abroad Programs
event.description: If you are interested in study abroad and want to learn more, please feel free to connect with representative Jim Sawyer, who will be hosting an informal information session from 10:00 - 11:00 AM on Monday, February 11th regarding Temple University's study abroad programs available to Carnegie Mellon students.
event.summary: jim Sawyer will be hosting an informal information session from 10:00 - 11:00 AM on Monday, February 11th regarding Temple University's study abroad programs available to Carnegie Mellon students.

event.name: Gangster Squad 9:30, 11:30
event.description: Los Angeles, 1949: A secret crew of police officers led by two determined sergeants work together in an effort to take down the ruthless mob king Mickey Cohen who runs the city. An AB Films Movie
event.summary: An AB Films Movie

event.name: IRO Information Session
event.description: International Relations Organization information session. This will give attendees a brief overview of what we do in IRO. We will discuss Model UN conferences we attend, the Model UN conference we run, as well as other IRO activities.
event.summary: International Relations Organization information session. This will give attendees a brief overview of what we do in IRO. We will discuss Model UN conferences we attend, the Model UN conference we run, as well as other IRO activities.

event.name: Poster Session: Independent Study and Senior Thesis
event.description: A poster session or poster presentation is the presentation of research information by an individual or representatives of research teams at a congress or conference with an academic or professional focus. The work is usually peer reviewed. Poster sessions are particularly prominent at scientific conferences such as medical congresses.
event.summary: Poster Session

event.name: Study Abroad Information Session
event.description: Over 500 CMU students, from all majors, study abroad annually. All are welcome to attend this overview of study abroad, from general curriculum compatibility to finances. Returned students will also speak about their individual study abroad experiences and will be available for a Q and A.
event.summary: Over 500 CMU students, from all majors, study abroad annually. All are welcome to attend this overview of study abroad, from general curriculum compatibility to finances. Returned students will also speak about their individual study abroad experiences and will be available for a Q and A.

event.name: Origami Rose Sales
event.description:
Origami (from ori meaning "folding", and kami meaning "paper" (kami changes to gami due to rendaku) is the traditional Japanese art of paper folding, which started in the 17th century AD at the latest and was popularized outside of Japan in the mid-1900s. It has since then evolved into a modern art form. The goal of this art is to transform a flat sheet of paper into a finished sculpture through folding and sculpting techniques, and as such the use of cuts or glue are not considered to be origami. Paper cutting and gluing is usually considered kirigami.
Origami Club will be selling beautiful Origami Roses! Come buy your sweetheart a rose that will last forever, just like your love!
We will be selling on February 12 and 13, from 5-9PM in the UC
One rose for $2
Three roses for $5.
event.summary: Origami Club will be selling beautiful Origami Roses! Come buy your sweetheart a rose that will last forever, just like your love!

event.name: Silver Linings Playbook 9:30, 12
event.description: After a stint in a mental institution, former teacher Pat Solitano moves back in with his parents and tries to reconcile with his ex-wife. Things get more challenging when Pat meets Tiffany, a mysterious girl with problems of her own. An AB Films Movie
event.summary: An AB Films Movie

event.name: Palantir Tech Talk
event.description:
Palantir Technologies is working to radically change how groups analyze information. We were founded in 2004 by a handful of PayPal alumni and Stanford computer scientists. Since then we've doubled in size every year while retaining our early-stage values: a startup culture, strong work ethic and rigorous hiring standards.
We currently offer a suite of software applications for integrating, visualizing and analyzing the world's information. We support many kinds of data including structured, unstructured, relational, temporal and geospatial.
Our products are built for real analysis with a focus on security, scalability, ease of use and collaboration. They are broadly deployed in the intelligence, defense, law enforcement and financial communities, and are spreading rapidly by word of mouth into applications in other industries and realms of impact.
Palantir is headquartered in downtown Palo Alto, CA, with offices around the world. The contents of this tech talk are TBA. Check your email for updates!
event.summary: The contents of this tech talk are TBA. Check your email for updates!

event.name: AB Skibo Presents - Craig Schoedler
event.description:
For a change of pace, come see Craig Schoedler jazz it up with the bass in Skibo Cafe. His critically acclaimed music has been well-recieved both in the US and Europe, exploring styles ranging from Bach Cello Suites to Beatles covers.
Craig Schoedler will be at Skibo Cafe Wednesday, Feb. 13 at 6:00pm.
event.summary: For a change of pace, come see Craig Schoedler jazz it up with the bass in Skibo Cafe. His critically acclaimed music has been well-recieved both in the US and Europe, exploring styles ranging from Bach Cello Suites to Beatles covers.

event.name: Live and Become 9:30
event.description:
In 1980 the black Falashas in Ethiopia are recognised as genuine Jews. In turn they are secretly carried to Israel. The day before the transport the son of a Jewish mother dies. In his place and with his name (Schlomo) she takes a Christian 9-year-old boy. Upon arrival this second mother dies. Schlomo is adopted by a good family but remains depressed until he secretly sends a letter to his real mother. From the beginning he experiences large and small racist difficulties. In his teens he and Sarah fall in love. Her father is an extreme racist. Schlomo tries to gain "real Jewishness" by winning a competition in Bible interpretation. No change of Sarah's father's attitude. Disappointed he goes to the police and reports himself as not being a Jew. But the police officer just gives him a scolding. "The newspapers are full of that stuff, the Falashas are no Jews. Now they begin to believe it themselves." His adoptive parents send him to France to study medicine. When he afterwards marries Sarah she loses her family and her status as a "white Jew". But he dares not tell her the truth until she becomes pregnant. She leaves him, but only because he had not trusted that she would love him as much anyway. His adoptive mother reconciles them. Sarah's first line when she returns: "Unbelievable what three mothers would do for you." But she makes a condition for returning: Schlomo must meet his real mother again. As a doctor he takes a job in the Ethiopian fugitive camp where she is still alive.
An AB Films Movie
event.summary: An AB Films Movie

event.name: The Master
event.description:
A Naval veteran arrives home from war unsettled and uncertain of his future - until he is tantalized by The Cause and its charismatic leader.
AB Films is showing The Master on Thursday, February 14
Showtimes:
7:30 pm 10:00 pm 12:30 am Runtime: 144 minutes (2hr 24min)
Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise
event.summary: The Master follows the story of a Naval veteran who returns in the 1950s struggling with his future until he finds the charismatic leader/intellectual and his cause.

event.name: Life of Pi
event.description:
A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger. AB Films is showing Life of Pi on Friday, February 15 Showtimes: 7:30 pm 10:00 pm 12:30 am Runtime: 127 minutes (2hr 7min)
Price: $1 with CMU ID (must show ID); $3 otherwise
event.summary: Based on the Best-Selling Novel and nominated for 11 Oscars (including Best Picture, Directing, and Visual Effects), Life of Pi is the unbelievable tale of the journey of two unlikely survivors of a shipwreck - a young man and a Bengal tiger.

event.name: 12 ANGRY MEN
event.description:
A dissenting juror in a murder trial slowly manages to convince the others that the case is not as obviously clear as it seemed in court. Come see "12 Angry Men": an intense drama about members of a murder trial jury who hold the life of another in their hands. Though they start by believing that their minds are made up, they soon come to realize that the facts might not be as clear as they originally appeared in the courtroom.
Tickets are available at snstheatre.org $3 Student/$5 General
Show times are: February 15th at 8pm February 16th at 2pm and 6pm
Director: James Alexander Assistant Director: Ethan Crystal
CAST Juror #1: Diane Koeller Juror #2: Emma Harger Juror #3: Kevin Handerhan Juror #4: Eleanor Lewis Juror #5: Raz Golden Juror #6: Tyler Harper Juror #7: Bradley Plaxen Juror #8: Andrew Bueno Juror #9: Erika Tang Juror #10: Christopher Sparks Juror #11: SL Rao Juror #12: Richman Neumann Bailiff: Billy Veer
event.summary: Come see "12 Angry Men": an intense drama about members of a murder trial jury who hold the life of another in their hands. Though they start by believing that their minds are made up, they soon come to realize that the facts might not be as clear as they originally appeared in the courtroom.

event.name: [CMU] Carnival
event.description:
The Carnegie Mellon University Spring Carnival is the biggest annual event in the school year. Student organizations across campus, whether independent or Greek, work very hard to succeed in uniquely competitive events featured during the three-day period. Spring Carnival features numerous attractions: Booth, Buggy, concerts, the midway tents, a comedian, and activities for people of all ages!
Above, you can learn a little bit more about all of these events, and maybe this year you can join us!
event.summary: An event hosted by the Association for Computing Machinery

event.name: Olympus Show and Tell Event
event.description:
Project Olympus, a Carnegie Mellon innovation center, operates at the earliest stages of the value creation chain. It aims to augment and accelerate the process of moving cutting-edge research and great ideas to development and business stages through licensing, creating start-ups, and through corporate collaboration and strategic partnerships. Olympus provides start-up advice, micro-grants, incubator space, and connections for faculty and students across campus and with the wider regional, national and global business communities. How to work with us
A main goal is to create a climate, culture and community to enable talent and ideas to grow, creating a dynamic commercialization eco-system. An initiative of the School of Computer Science, Project Olympus works collaboratively with all members of the university’s Innovation Eco-system. Based within the university’s academic sector, Olympus can easily tap into promising innovations that build on the wealth of university research and student ingenuity. Fostering collaborations, both on and off campus, Olympus leverages considerable community expertise and resources.
event.summary: An event hosted by the Association for Computing Machinery

event.name: Buggy Finals
event.description: Buggy (also called "Sweepstakes") is a unique race that has been held on and behind the Carnegie Mellon University campus during the spring carnival since 1920. It is part uphill relay race (in which the baton is a vehicle and driver pushed by runners), and part downhill gravity racing with exciting sharp turns and speeds up to 40mph. Sweepstakes final races.

event.name: Hack+ Finale
event.description:
Hack+ is a semester long hackathon, and you will be given resources and mentors to help you produce those awesome application ideas. What you receive from it is equivalent to what you dedicate. This means you set your own pace, your own time, and develop your own ideas. You can meet with your team weekly, monthly, or even finish your project during your own 24-hour hackathon!
Some time to finish up and then it all ends :( Be prepared to dazzle all with the culmination of your semester's work and admire the work of others. There will be judges, prizes, and fun!
event.summary: Some time to finish up and then it all ends :( Be prepared to dazzle all with the culmination of your semester's work and admire the work of others. There will be judges, prizes, and fun!

event.name: eBay Office Hours
event.description:
With more than 124 million active users globally, eBay is the world's largest online marketplace, where practically anyone can buy and sell practically anything. Founded in 1995, eBay connects a diverse and passionate community of individual buyers and sellers, as well as small businesses. Their collective impact on ecommerce is staggering, and more than 500 million items are listed on eBay.
Learn about the eBay API
event.summary: Learn about the eBay API

event.name: Check-In
event.description:
Despite the ultimate goal of building a really cool, useful product, hackathons tend to only draw the students who already have the technical skills necessary to build a cool product. But the hardest part of a hackathon can be coming up with an idea, finding people to work with, or getting the data you need to create a great app.
TartanHacks tries to solve those problems. Instead of 24 hours of coders trying to find an idea, Tartanhacks is 24 hours of ideas that are just itching to be written into code. Check in for TartanHacks. You must be registered to check in!
event.summary: Check in for TartanHacks. You must be registered to check in!

event.name: END OF HACKING and Dinnertime
event.description:
You must complete a submission to the Audition submission system, available through TartanHacks' OnStage platform before 6:00:00PM EST on Saturday, January 26th, 2013.
Hacks submitted late will not be eligible for prizes.
event.summary: Time's up! Take a break from that intense coding with a lovely dinner, and then get ready to present during demo time!

event.description: It's demo time! Teams present their hacks in 90 second presentations to show the fruits of their labors!
